tooltips.oeeFormula: OEE = Availability x Performance x Quality
tooltips.availabilityDescription: Equipment uptime vs scheduled production time
tooltips.performanceDescription: Actual production rate vs ideal rate
tooltips.qualityDescription: Good units produced vs total units
tooltips.productionTodayDescription: Units produced today vs daily target
tooltips.downtimeDescription: Number of machines currently experiencing downtime
tooltips.qualityAlertsDescription: Active quality issues and holds requiring attention
tooltips.attendanceDescription: Percentage of scheduled workforce present today
tooltips.workOrdersDescription: Active work orders by aging: Green(<7d), Yellow(7-14d), Red(>14d)
tooltips.otdDescription: Percentage of orders delivered by promised date

kpi.title: Key Performance Indicators
kpi.efficiencyDescription: Track production output against targets and identify improvement areas
kpi.otdDescription: Track delivery performance and identify delays to improve customer satisfaction
kpi.wipAgingDescription: Monitor work-in-progress inventory age to optimize production flow
kpi.availabilityDescription: Monitor equipment uptime and identify downtime patterns for improvement
kpi.performanceDescription: Monitor production speed and throughput efficiency
kpi.qualityDescription: Comprehensive quality analysis: PPM, DPMO, FPY, RTY
kpi.oeeDescription: Comprehensive productivity metric combining Availability, Performance, and Quality
kpi.absenteeismDescription: Track employee attendance patterns and absence rates
kpi.reworkRateTooltipMeaning: Percentage of units that required in-line corrections or quick fixes. Rework is typically handled by the same operator without significant additional resources.
kpi.repairRateTooltipMeaning: Percentage of units requiring significant resources or external repair. Repair involves dedicated repair stations, specialized personnel, or external services.
kpi.scrapRateTooltipMeaning: Percentage of units that could not be salvaged and were discarded. These units failed quality and could not be successfully reworked or repaired.
kpi.recoveryRateTooltipMeaning: Percentage of failed units that were successfully recovered through rework or repair (vs scrapped). Higher is better - indicates ability to save defective units.

inferenceIndicator.hintText: This value includes estimated data. For full accuracy, enter actual values in the data entry forms.

defectTypes.title: Defect Type Catalog

admin.partOpportunitiesDescription: Configure defect opportunities per part for accurate DPMO calculation
admin.partOpportunitiesInfo: DPMO calculation uses opportunities per unit to measure defects per million opportunities. Different parts have different complexity levels affecting the number of potential defect opportunities.
admin.deletePartOpportunityConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete opportunities for part {part}?
admin.opportunitiesHint: Number of potential defect locations per unit (e.g., 10 for simple, 50+ for complex)

clientConfig.title: Client KPI Configuration
clientConfig.description: Configure client-specific KPI calculation parameters. Each client can override global defaults.
clientConfig.selectClientPrompt: Select a client to view or edit their KPI configuration.
clientConfig.confirmResetMessage: This will reset all KPI calculation parameters for {client} to global defaults. This action cannot be undone.

hints.otdMode: STANDARD: All orders, TRUE: Complete orders only, BOTH: Show both metrics

floatingPool.title: Floating Pool Management
floatingPool.description: Manage floating pool employees and their client assignments
floatingPool.selectClientRequired: Please select a client to assign
floatingPool.doubleAssignmentError: This employee is already assigned to another client. Please unassign first.
floatingPool.noInsightsAvailable: Run a simulation to see staffing insights

workflowConfig.title: Workflow Configuration
workflowConfig.description: Configure work order workflow statuses, transitions, and closure triggers per client.
workflowConfig.selectClientPrompt: Select a client to view or edit their workflow configuration.
workflowConfig.statusOrderHint: Select statuses that will be part of the workflow pipeline. The order determines the standard flow.
workflowConfig.optionalHint: Select statuses that can be skipped in the workflow (e.g., shipping stage for direct pickup orders).
workflowConfig.transitionHint: Configure which statuses can transition to each target status.
workflowConfig.templateWarning: This will replace the current workflow configuration. Existing work orders will not be affected.

closureHints.atShipment: Orders automatically close when marked as shipped
closureHints.atClientReceipt: Orders close when client confirms receipt
closureHints.atCompletion: Orders close immediately when production completes (skip shipping)
closureHints.manual: Orders must be manually closed by operators

csv.title: Bulk Upload via CSV
csv.dragDrop: Drag and drop a CSV file here
csv.invalidFormat: Invalid file format. Please use CSV.
csv.partOpportunitiesInfo: Upload a CSV file with part_number and opportunities_per_unit columns to bulk configure part opportunities.
csv.replaceExistingHint: If checked, existing entries for matching part numbers will be updated
